I think a lot of the Iranian novels of
the
last 20 years or
so highly
overrated um I don't think they they

a priority for those writers to um push

um I wonder if those people are are
writers even you know

really believe that and then there's
there's uh Cycles in history where one

around comes around always um and so
I just think that when you compare the
sort of literary tradition in Iran and
then put that up against those types of
books that have come out the Immigrant
Community the Exile Community it's just
shocking I mean Iran was a country where
you had such a progressive poet like f
farad um one of the you know greatest
confessional poets
probably in all of history you writing
this incredibly candid startling verse
in the 50s and 60s and then uh you also
had a writer like s who
um you know could could be talked of in

scary um incredibly Progressive um and
Innovative um
writing and then and then to compare it
with the stuff that's come out it's sort
of embarrassing it's like you know
looking at the great Indies versus
Hollywood
Blockbusters um so that that that
motivated me to try to write a book
where where the actual sentences were
um were uh you know rich and and and
well done there a lot of the female
writers um you know I I've I've been
sent their books before and um I I their
Shadow has sort of followed me a lot you
know um and and I'm sort of expect been
expected to embrace them and and say
we're all a happy family of these female
Iranian writers um but
um if anything I think they made it
tough for me to get my book published
because uh
I wasn't interested in those buzzword
and I wasn't interested in telling that
same story that seems to over and over
capture Western audiences um I wanted to
tell a different type of story and I
want to continue to write a different
type of book I I'd like it to be
incidental that I'm Iranian eventually
but for the time being I'm sort of
interested in some of those Middle
Eastern issues I happen to be so I might
linger there for a little while longer
but um My Hope Is that I can eventually
be free of what's expected of a person
um with my background
